instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.820-02020: What is 820-02020? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.A2338: What is A2338? A2338 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2020 M1, Mid 2022 M2 with EMC 8162, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02020, 820-02773..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi, received this logic board with little corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> and some around the toucid sensor chip. See attached pictures. Laptop boots when connected to battery and charger but does not charge. Also no 19v on USB C amp meter. Everything works when booted but only from battery. 

After cleaning with amtech V2 good flux saw that pin 8 of UF260 (USB ROM chip) was damaged. Cleaned it and added new solder. Still 5v 0,225a after 6 sec back to 0,055a. So tried a USB ROM from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> Same specs. Now it goes to 20v 0,109A but still no charger recognized... I remember reading something about copy rom before installing but never done that before.

Do you think rom chip is damaged and needs to be replaced?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message: Get correct dump, from the same board model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message: What do you mean with correct dump from same board model? How do you do that, do you have any video or explanation somewhere?!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Get a chip from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, not <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
You can read the chip and flash your own (from MLB).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message: I’m a Noob with flashing. I did flash bios before on motherboards. But never on MacBooks. Even not these kind of small chips. Can you maybe send me in any direction to any explanation?!? A how to? Or something. Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
UF260 is SPI memmory (a kind of EEPROM); just very small.

You can read and write it with correct adapter.
Same programmer used for laptop motherboards can do it, but need to fix the chip somehow on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Ok, thxs. I found this video, explaining the procedure... [MEDIA=youtube]ZCeisJ4zWp8[/MEDIA]
I'm excited to figure this out  aswell 

ButI don't have another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> chip to get the dump from. Maybe you can send me? Or anyone else?!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
Hi, I'm back again. So after getting a CH341 programmer and needed adapters to fix the rom chip. I flashed the a2238 dump (verified and everything) on to it but still getting 5v 0.225a and no charging... When I put the a2159rom back at least I get 19v 0,05a... What am I doing wrong? 

How can I know if the rom is ok?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message: Any tips on this issue? It is weird right? Ho can a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> rom give 19v and original <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> rom get stuck at 5v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
You've got 19V with original <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, at the beggining.
Something reacted to the heat applied many times on the board; this happens on the boards affected by corrosion.
May have problems with internal copper layers even.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 90786, member: 682"]
You've got 19V with original <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>, at the beggining.
[/QUOTE]
No, you are confused with my other post haha. This one was never charging. When connected to battery it will boot and work fine but does not charge. With original rom, keeps at 5v... But when I connect a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> rom it will go upon to 19v. But still no charger. So I flashed <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> rom to a new chip but still 5v. 

Just have to figure out why won't charge?! THXS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message: Maybe I can look anywhere else? HELP

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:
You should get 19V on input flashing <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2338</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> dump for <CHIP>U2890</CHIP>.
Be sure to use correct <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> version chip.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
threads.message:

Can I use 2 different version of the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> chip on one logic board. like this? Or should I use only pairs?[ATTACH type="full"]60845[/ATTACH][ATTACH]60845[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02020</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> M1 corrosion around <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
